title: Node.js: Async/Await Syntax
story: Async/await makes asynchronous code look synchronous. It's syntactic sugar for Promises!
instructions: Create an async function that awaits Promise.resolve('Hello Async!') and returns the result. Call it and print the output.

tests.expectedBehavior: Use async/await to get and print message

hints.text: Async functions automatically return a Promise. Use 'await' to wait for Promise resolution.
async function foo() { return await Promise.resolve(value); } - then call foo().then(console.log)
